column2: There are several approaches that
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: model information extraction as a to-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ken classification task, using various
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging strategies to combine multiple
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tokens. We describe the tagging strate-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies that can be found in the litera-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ture and evaluate their relative perfor-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mances. We also introduce a new strat-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: egy, called Begin/After tagging or BIA,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: and show that it is competitive to the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: best other strategies.

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The purpose of information extraction (IE) is to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: find desired pieces of information in natural lan-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage texts and store them in a form that is
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: suitable for automatic querying and processing.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: IE requires a predefined output representation
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: (target structure) and only searches for facts
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: that fit this representation. Simple target struc-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tures define just a number of slots to be filled
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with a string extracted from a text (slot filler ).
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: For this simple kind of information extraction,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: statistical approaches that model IE as a token
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classification task have proved very successful.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: These systems split a text into a series of to-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: kens and invoke a trainable classifier to decide
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: for each token whether or not it is part of a slot
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: filler of a certain type. To re-assemble the clas-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sified tokens into multi-token slot fillers, various
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging strategies can be used.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: So far, each classification-based IE approach
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-capital

column2: combines a specific tagging strategy with a spe-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cific classification algorithm and specific other
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: parameter settings, making it hard to detect
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: how each of these choices influences the results.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To allow systematic research into these choices,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: we have designed a generalized IE system that
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: allows utilizing any tagging strategy with any
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classification algorithm. This makes it possible
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to compare strategies or algorithms in an iden-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tical setting. In this paper, we describe the tag-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ging strategies that can be found in the liter-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ature and evaluate them in the context of our
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: framework. We also introduce a new strategy,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: called Begin/After tagging or BIA, and show
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that it is competitive to the best other strate-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies. While there are various approaches that
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: employ a classification algorithm with one of the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging strategies described below, there are no
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: other comparative analyses of tagging strategies
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: yet, to the best of our knowledge.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In the next section, we describe how IE can
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: be modeled as a token classification task and ex-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: plain the tagging strategies that can be used for
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: this purpose. In Sec. 3 we describe the IE frame-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: work and the experimental setup used for com-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: paring the various tagging strategies. In Sec. 4
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: we list and analyze the results of the compari-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: son.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 Modeling Information Extraction
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1

column2: as a Token Classification Task
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: There are multiple approaches that model IE as
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: a token classification task, employing standard
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Proceedings of the Human Language Technology Conference of the North American Chapter of the ACL, pages 149–152,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-smallest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: Table 1: Properties of Tagging Strategies
column3: page=1 xpos=2 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-table headchar-capital column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: classification algorithms. These systems split a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: text into a series of tokens and invoke a trainable
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classifier to decide for each token whether or not
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it is part of a slot filler of a certain type. To re-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: assemble the classified tokens into multi-token
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: slot fillers, various tagging strategies can be used.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The trivial (Triv ) strategy would be to use
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line line-space headchar-capital

column2: a single class for each slot type and an addi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tional “O” class for all other tokens. However,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: this causes problems if two entities of the same
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: type immediately follow each other, e.g. if the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: names of two speakers are separated by a line-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: break only. In such a case, both names would
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: be collapsed into a single entity, since the trivial
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strategy lacks a way to mark the begin of the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: second entity.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: For this reason (as well as for improved classi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: fication accuracy), various more complex strate-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies are employed that use distinct classes to
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: mark the first and/or last token of a slot filler.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The two variations of IOB tagging are proba-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: bly most common: the variant usually called
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: IOB2 classifies each token as the begin of a slot
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: filler of a certain type (B-type), as a continua-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of the previously started slot filler, if any
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (I-type), or as not belonging to any slot filler
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: (O). The IOB1 strategy differs from IOB2 in us-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing B-type only if necessary to avoid ambiguity
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (i.e. if two same-type entities immediately follow
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: each other); otherwise I-type is used even at the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: beginning of slot fillers. While the Triv strat-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: egy uses only n + 1 classes for n slot types, IOB
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging requires 2n + 1 classes.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: BIE tagging differs from IOB in using an ad-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ditional class for the last token of each slot filler.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: One class is used for the first token of a slot filler
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: (B-type), one for inner tokens (I-type) and an-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: other one for the last token (E-type). A fourth
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: class BE-type is used to mark slot fillers consist-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing of a single token (which is thus both begin
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and end). BIE requires 4n + 1 classes.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: A disadvantage of the BIE strategy is the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: high number of classes it uses (twice as many
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: as IOB1|2 ). This can be addressed by introduc-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing a new strategy, BIA (or Begin/After tag-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ging). Instead of using a separate class for the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: last token of a slot filler, BIA marks the first to-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ken after a slot filler as A-type (unless it is the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: begin of a new slot filler). Begin (B-type) and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: continuation (I-type) of slot fillers are marked in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the same way as by IOB2. BIA requires 3n + 1
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classes, n less than BIE since no special treat-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ment of single-token slot fillers is necessary.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: The strategies discussed so far require only a
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: single classification decision for each token. An-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: other option is to use two separate classifiers,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: one for finding the begin and another one for
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: finding the end of slot fillers. Begin/End (BE )
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging requires n + 1 classes for each of the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: two classifiers (B-type + O for the first, E-type
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: + O for the second). In this case, there is no
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: distinction between inner and outer (other) to-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: kens. Complete slot fillers are found by com-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: bining the most suitable begin/end pairs of the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: same type, e.g. by taking the length distribution
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of slots into account. Table 1 lists the properties
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of all strategies side by side.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that a suitable implementation or adapter ex-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ists. For this paper, we have used the Winnow

column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line year page-bottom

column2: the context representation described in (Siefkes,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 2005), varying only the tagging strategy. An ad-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line year tailchar-hiphen

column2: vantage of Winnow is its supporting incremen-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tal training as well as batch training. For
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 5 Conclusion
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Previously, classification-based approaches to IE
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: have combined a specific tagging strategy with
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a specific classification algorithm and specific
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: other parameter settings, making it hard to de-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tect how each of these choices influences the re-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sults. We have designed a generalized IE sys-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem that allows exploring each of these choices
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in isolation. For this paper, we have tested the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tagging strategies that can be found in the lit-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erature. We have also introduced a new tagging
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strategy, BIA (Begin/After tagging).
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-line-space

column2: Our results indicate that the choice of a tag-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ging strategy, while not crucial, should not be
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: neglected when implementing a statistical IE
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: system. The IOB2 strategy, which is very
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: popular, having been used in public challenges
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: such as those of CoNLL (Tjong Kim Sang and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: De Meulder, 2003) and JNLPBA (Kim et al.,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: 2004), has been found to be indeed the best
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line year above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=3 xpos=4 ypos=9 left-column left-indent right-over indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only column-bottom

column2: of all established tagging strategies. It is ri-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: valed by the new BIA strategy. In typical sit-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: uations, using one of those strategies should be
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a good choice—since BIA requires more classes,
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: it makes sense to prefer IOB2 when in doubt.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Considering that it is not much worse, the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Triv strategy which requires only a single class
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: per slot type might be useful in situations where
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the number of available classes is limited or the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: space or time overhead of additional classes is
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: high. The two-classifier BE strategy is still in-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: teresting if used as part of a more refined ap-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: proach, as done by the ELIE system (Finn and
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Kushmerick, 2004). <sup>4</sup> Future work will be to ob-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line year headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: serve how well these results generalize in the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: context of other classifiers and other corpora.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To combine the strengths of different tagging
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: strategies, ensemble meta-strategies utilizing the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: results of multiple strategies could be explored.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column centered right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
